page.title: 09GAELIC PLACE NAMES
page.content: The village of Kiltarlity used to be called Altfearn,from the Gaelic 'allt' (a burn or stream) and 'fearn' (an alder tree).The name Kiltarlity comes from the Gaelic 'cil'(a cell or church) and Tallorchan or Tallarican,an early Christian missionary who had his 'cell' on the banks of the river Beauly,where there is now an old ruined{church}and graveyard,although these date from much later than the time of Tallorchan .The 'alder tree by the burn' still survives in local placenames as Allarburn. There is a chambered cairn at Culburnie and a burial chamber at Belladrum,both of which date from Iron Age times.
